taxon_name.authority: Rydberg in N. L. Britton et al.

taxon_identification.taxon_hierarchy: family asteraceae;tribe heliantheae;subtribe peritylinae;genus perityle;section laphamia;species staurophylla;variety homoflora

bio:treatment.description: Leaves: lobes usually linear to filiform. Ray florets 0. 2n = 34.
Crevices in limestone and granite cliffs;
bio:treatment.discussion: Variety homoflora occurs at the northern end of the San Andres Mountains (Rhodes Canyon and northward) in south-central New Mexico. A waxy, white coating on the cypselae, which was included by the describing author as a distinguishing characteristic, also occurs in some populations of var. staurophylla and other species of Perityle as well.
